intro: Chrysocoma trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined chrysocoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in compact clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a distinctive three-veined structure, giving it its scientific name. Chrysocoma trinervis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
